encode_utils.tests.test_utils¶

Tests functions in the utils module. A few test data files are used from within the ‘data’ folder. The contents of the files are explained here. When a test utilizes any of them, you can check here to read the documentation about the contents of that file.

  • replicates_for_ENCSR502NRF.json Contains the value of the ‘replicates’ property for the actual experiment ENCSR502NRF. There are two replicates:
    • michael-snyder:L-3525-1_ENCSR502NRF with biological_replicate_number=1 and technical_replicate_number=1. It belongs to library accession ENCLB690UAL.
    • michael-snyder:L-3526-2_ENCSR502NRF with biological_replicate_number=2 and technical_replicate_number=1. It belongs to library accession ENCLB782CIR.
  • test_fq_40recs.fastq.gz Contains 40 FASTQ records.
class encode_utils.tests.test_utils.TestUtils(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Tests the utils.py module.

test_add_to_set()[source]¶

Tests the function utils.add_to_set() for success when all elements are already unique.

test_add_to_set_2()[source]¶

Tests the function utils.add_to_set() for success when there are duplicates.

test_calculate_md5_sum()[source]¶

Tests the function calculate_md5_sum() for success.

test_clean_alias_name()[source]¶

Tests the function clean_alias_name() for success.

test_does_lib_replicate_exist()[source]¶

Test the function utils.does_lib_replicate_exist() for correct result when we only care about whether the library has any replicates, and not any particular one.

test_2_does_lib_replicate_exist()[source]¶

Test the function utils.does_lib_replicate_exist() for the correct result when we restrict the replicate search to only those with the specific biological_replicate_number.

test_3_does_lib_replicate_exist()[source]¶

Test the function utils.does_lib_replicate_exist() for the empty result when we restrict the replicates search to a biological_replicate_number that does not apply.

test_4_does_lib_replicate_exist()[source]¶

Test the function utils.does_lib_replicate_exist() for the empty result when we restrict the replicates search to a biological_replicate_number that does apply but a technical_replicate_number that doesn’t.

test_5_does_lib_replicate_exist()[source]¶

Test the function utils.does_lib_replicate_exist() for the empty result when the library accession doesn’t belong to any of the replicates.

test_strip_alias_prefix()[source]¶

Tests the function strip_alias_prefix for success.
